snippet: Paul Singer, the head of the $25 billion hedge fund Elliott Management, made no secret of his distaste for the Federal Reserve’s efforts to keep interest rates low as a way to stimulate the economy.
abstract: Paul Singer, the head of the $25 billion hedge fund Elliott Management, made no secret of his distaste for the Federal Reserve’s efforts to keep interest rates low as a way to stimulate the economy.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

lead_paragraph: Paul Singer, the head of the $25 billion hedge fund Elliott Management, has never been shy about expressing his views.

headline.main: Paul Singer Pins Blame on Fed for Income Inequality
